name: Fantastic
detailed_location: HELIOS OneHoover Dam(after That Lucky Old Sun, optional)

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Hey man, when in Rome.

topics.topic_text: [Attack] You won't need to worry about bills where you're going.
topics.response_text: Newsflash. Fantastic is irreplaceable.

topics.topic_text: I sent power to McCarran and the Strip.
topics.response_text: Whoa, really? Ho, shit! I knew I could do it. Those NCR pricks can all get on their knees and worship at the altar of fucking Fantastic!

topics.topic_text: That's right. I'm here for your job.
topics.response_text: Ah, shit. Shit, man. I need this. Gotta pay the bills. And I'm addicted to a lot of different kinds of chems. I mean a lot.

topics.topic_text: How did you get this job?
topics.response_text: It was easy, man. They were going door to door asking if anyone knew any scientists. I said look no further.

topics.topic_text: I am now.
topics.response_text: Well hey, if you find yourself up at the mainframe, do yourself a favor and make sure you send the power to the right place.

topics.topic_text: What job do you have here?
topics.response_text: What else? I'm in charge. This whole operation depends on me. No Fantastic, no power. Got the whole NCR suckling my teats, and it feels so good.

topics.topic_text: So you have no idea what you're doing.
topics.response_text: No, man. I know exactly what I'm doing. I just don't know what effect it's going to have.

topics.topic_text: No.
topics.response_text: Ah well. Guess I'll have to wait for the next curious sucker.

topics.topic_text: You pay me a stack of caps right now and I'll forget you have my job.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Aw, man. How am I supposed to buy chems now? Fine. Here.

topics.topic_text: How would someone retarget the mirrors?
topics.response_text: There's these two terminals outside. They control the mirrors. I tried fooling with them but didn't get very far.

topics.topic: VMS03FantasticSettleDownSettle down. I'm not here to replace anyone.
topics.topic_text: Actually I'm not here to replace you.
topics.response_text: Damn right, you're not. Goddamn right. Why would they? You can't top this guy. Just a little more time. You can't keep Fantastic down for long.

topics.topic_text: Why should the power go to the Strip and McCarran?
topics.response_text: Because I get paid, that's why. Per kilowatt-hour, whatever the hell that is. That's where the NCR wants the power, so that's where I want it.

topics.topic_text: Fantastic? What are you doing here?
topics.response_text: What's it look like, man? I'm fucking king of the NCR. Caesar's Legion has Caesar, the NCR's got Fantastic. It's Fantastic's NCR now.

topics.topic_text: Get this straight. You're not my master.
topics.response_text: Whoa, hey. All right, man. It's cool. Who said anything about being your master?

topics.topic_text: What are your responsibilities now?
topics.response_text: Man, what aren't my responsibilities? Dam overflow, dam underflow. Dam leakage. Sometimes the dam gets too big and I have to shrink it down.{Emph. "aren't"}

topics.topic_text: They put you in charge of Hoover Dam?
topics.response_text: They sure as shit did. I mean there's still formalities, like I have to run everything by Lawson before I do it.

topics.topic_text: So you have to do whatever Lawson tells you.
topics.response_text: No, man. That's just what I'm supposed to do.

topics.topic_text: Is Ignacio dead over there? Did you kill him?
topics.response_text: Man, I don't even know. It's crazy.

topics.topic_text: You're with the Legion?
topics.response_text: Shh. You feel that? That's the winds of change, baby, and Fantastic's riding them with his magic angel wings.

topics.topic_text: What will you do now?
topics.response_text: I'm working on some top secret shit I can't even tell you about, it's so mind-blowing.

topics.topic_text: What are you trying to accomplish?
topics.response_text: Well, see, we're getting power, because the guy running this place is Fantastic.

topics.topic_text: What exactly do you do?
topics.response_text: Fuck, man. Everything. I push buttons. I turn dials. I read numbers.  Sometimes I make up little stories in my head about what the numbers mean.

topics.topic_text: Why are you worried about being replaced?
topics.response_text: Worried? Do I look worried to you? I've got this under control, baby. No one else can do what I do here.{In denial.}

conversation.response_text: Here, you'll want this. It's the password to one of the terminals outside. Found it written on one of the stalls in the bathroom.

description:
Fantastic is a 40 year-old Caucasian Male.

A con artist working as an NCR contractor at HELIOS One, Fantastic lacks the technical skills required for his position but maintains it through deception to fund his chem addiction.

Fantastic's Personality: Immature, egotistical, self-centered, and deceptive. He's quick to defend his incompetence and often uses his drug addiction as a sympathy plea.

Fantastic's Backstory: Before being recruited by the NCR, Fantastic was a small-time con artist, specializing in scams that preyed on people's trust in technical expertise. He managed to secure his position at HELIOS One through a combination of lies and a superficial understanding of technical jargon. Once hired, he quickly realized he was in over his head but instead of admitting his shortcomings, he doubled down on deception, creating an illusion of competence to maintain his position and income.
